document_data.name: Tuckpurse Alley
document_data.mainbody: '''Tuckpurse Alley''' was an alleyway of hard-packed dirt and [[gravel]]
document_data.Geography: This alleyway came off the easternmost end of [[Spendthrift Alley]], circled around a small block of buildings, then went south and west to the easternmost end of [[Vellarr's Lane]].
document_data.Notable Inhabitants: This alleyway was quite frequented at night by [[thieves]]. Some of these thugs were known to use children to trip or snatch goods from those passing through the alley.
document_data.Notable Locations: * At the back of the store [[Thond Glass and Glazing]] stood a large rain barrel. After the barrel's gutter was diverted from it, sometime long before [[1363 DR]], thugs began to crouch inside of the barrel and watch for passersby through its knotholes.
